titleStmt.title: R. L. Garvin to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1850

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
3 Springs Hart County Ky April 30th 1864
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlet Gov of Ky

My Dear Sir Some time ago I wrote to ^you^ tendering to you my resignation as Justice of of the Peace for Hart County.. I again request you to receive it as circumstances have come up in Such a way that makes it necessary for me to resign.. and I have conversed with a majority of the voters of this district and they request you to appoint and commission C. C. Larimore as my Successor and early compliance with this request will much oblige yours &c

Hart Co.
J. P
Appt
C C Larimor
3d May/64
Resignation accepted -- & commission issue to the person recommended -- I know Esq Garvin & can rely on his recommenation
